tooltips.region: Geographic areas where climate change/sea level rise vulnerability studies have been conducted.
tooltips.hazard: Spatial extent for different coastal hazards that may affect coastal assets.  Impact zones were estimated across multiple planning horizons.
tooltips.climate: Future planning horizons representing the impact of climate change.
tooltips.scenario: Sea level rise scenarios (low, medium, and high) based on the regional sea level rise amounts.

tooltips.region: Geographic areas where climate change/sea level rise vulnerability studies have been conducted.
tooltips.hazard: Spatial extent for different coastal hazards that may affect coastal assets.  Impact zones were estimated across multiple planning horizons.
tooltips.climate: Future planning horizons representing the impact of climate change.
tooltips.scenario:
Sea level rise scenarios (low, intermediate, high, and extreme) based on regional sea level rise amounts. Below is a table showing the scenario projections of relative sea level rise at Toke Point, Washington (NOAA 2017):

Scenario203020502100
Low4 cm (1.6 in)8 cm (3.1 in)19 cm (7.5 in)
Inter11 cm (4.3 in)25 cm (9.8 in)83 cm (32.7 in)
High22 cm (8.7 in)59 cm (23.2 in)229 cm (90.2 in)
Extr27 cm (10.6 in)73 cm (28.7 in)289 cm (113.8 in)

options.name: Sea Level Rise
options.description: Historical sea level trends are available from NOAA tide stations at Toke Point.
